content:
• Wednesday, December 6, 2017
  • AVGO

    Broadcom +4.4% as wireless chips drive Q4 beat, strong guidance

    • Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) is up 4.4% in after-hours trade following fiscal Q4 earnings where it beat the Street thanks to healthy demand for wireless chips spurred by smartphones.
    • As Credit Suisse noted earlier today, one watchword was guidance, and (based in part on its Brocade acquisition) Broadcom forecast Q1 net revenues of $5.225B-$5.375B, well above consensus for $4.836B.
    • It's also boost its long-term free cash flow target to 40% of net revenue, from 35%.
    • Net income came to $636M, vs. a loss of $632M a year ago.
    • Gross margin was $2.383B (49.2% of net revenue). operating income was $865M (17.9% of net revenue).
    • Revenue by segment: Wired infrastructure, $2.146B (up 3%); Wireless communications, $1.796B (up 33%); Enterprise storage, $645M (up 15%); Industrial and other, $257M (up 66%).
    • Cash and short-term investments came to $11.2B, vs. the previous quarter's $5.449B. It got $1.959B in cash from operations and $3.98B from issuing long-term debt, along with $440M from sale of real property.
    • Broadcom says it will continue to target long-term annual revenue growth of 5%, but raise its target for non-GAAP gross margin to 65% and for non-GAAP operating margin to 47.5%.
    • Earnings slides
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:09 PM | 17 Comments
  • DPW

    Digital Power denies rumors of Amazon cryptocurrency deal

    • Digital Power (NYSEMKT:DPW) finished -24% in today's trade after rising as much as 41%, as it denies rumors of an agreement with Amazon for $450M in cryptocurrency hardware.
    • "While DPW has made moves towards entering the cryptocurrency and digital mining spaces and has disclosed its activities in recent press releases and will continue to do so, DPW categorically denies the validity and accuracy of any such rumors," the company says.
    • DPW +13.8% after-hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM | 14 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: SEAC +23.9%. TLRD +11.3%. CMTL +7.4%. LULU +6.6%. OKTA +4.8%.
    • Top losers: VRNT -7.1%. AVDL -5.3%. KFY -4.3%. NOAH -3.7%. KEYS -2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • KEYS

    Keysight -4.5% on Q4 beats, downside guidance

    • Keysight (NYSE:KEYS) shares are down 4.5% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat EPS estimates and missed on revenue. Q1 guidance has revenue from $780M to $820M (consensus: $864.09M) and EPS from $0.29 to $0.43 (consensus: $0.61).
    • 1H18 guidance has revenue at $1.775B ($1.76B consensus) and EPS at $1.29 ($1.28 consensus). 
    • Seasonality of revenue will be impacted for a few quarters since Keysight’s headquarters were under mandatory evacuation for three weeks due to the California wildfires.   
    • Press release       
    • Previously: Keysight beats by $0.07, misses on revenue (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 4 Comments
  • OLLI

    Solid quarter posted by Ollie's Bargain Outlet

    • Ollie's Bargain Outlet Holdings (NASDAQ:OLLI) reports comparable sales increased 2.1% in Q3.
    • Gross margin rate was down 50 bps to 41.2% of sales. A fall in merchandise margins was only partially offset by lower supply chain costs.
    • Operating income was up 100 bps to 10.2% of sales.
    • Adjusted EBITDA increased 24% to $29.M to account for 12.3% of sales vs. 11.7% a year ago.
    • The retailer expects FY18 revenue of $1.062B to $1.065B vs. $1.07B consensus and EPS of  $1.21 fo $1.22 vs $1.21 consensus.
    • Previously: Ollie's Bargain Outlet beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Dec. 6)
    • OLLI +0.20% AH to $51.10.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • GPMT

    Granite Point Mortgage with convertible note offering

    • The company plans to sell up to $125M in principal amount of five-year convertible paper, with underwriter greenshoe for up to another $18.75M.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Updating the business thus far in Q4, GPMT has closed commercial real estate loans totaling about $252M. The pipeline as of the start of the month was about $137M of loans, with some of this amount expected to close before year-end.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Shares down 1.4% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • LULU

    Comparable sales shine at Lululemon

    • Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) reports comparable sales increased 8% in Q3 to blast past the consensus estimate for a 5% gain. On a constant dollar basis, comparable sales were up 7%.
    • Gross margin was 52.2% of sales during the quarter vs. 51.1%  a year ago.
    • Operating margin increased 30 bps Y/Y to 17.4% of sales.
    • "As we start the holiday season, I'm energized by our momentum and we are increasing guidance to reflect this performance," says Lululemon CEO Laurent Potdevin.
    • Looking ahead, Lululemon sees full-year revenue of $2.590B to $2.605B vs. $2.60B consensus and full-year EPS $2.45 to $2.48 vs. $2.40 consensus.
    • The company says the board approved a $200M share buyback plan.
    • Previously: Lululemon Athletica beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (Dec. 6)
    • LULU +6.55% premarket to $72.09
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 5 Comments
  • LULU

    Lululemon Athletica beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Lululemon Athletica (NASDAQ:LULU): Q3 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $619M (+13.7% Y/Y) beats by $9.11M.
    • Shares +3.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • SEAC

    SeaChange beats by $0.08, beats on revenue

    • SeaChange (NASDAQ:SEAC): Q3 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $23.4M (+17.2% Y/Y) beats by $3.89M.
    • Shares +6%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 11 Comments
  • C

    Citi joins JPMorgan and BofA in seeing lame Q4 trading revenue

    • Speaking at an investor conference, Citigroup (NYSE:C) CFO John Gerspach says to expect a "high teens" year-over-year decline in trading revenue in Q4. That's a bit worse than the 15% floated by JPMorgan and Bank of America yesterday.
    • Gerspach also sees the bank booking a $20B charge (presumably against its DTA) if the Senate tax bill becomes law.
    • Citi added to the day's losses as Gerspach spoke, closing down 1.45%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 3 Comments
  • TMST

    TimkenSteel -14% after KeyBanc downgrade

    • TimkenSteel (TMST -14.1%) tumbles after KeyBanc downgrades shares to Underweight from Sector Weight with a $12 price target, as the firm says its conversations with supply chain contacts indicate 2018 contract pricing upside likely will fall meaningfully short of YTD spot pricing upside near $110/ton.
    • KeyBanc says it now has a "materially more conservative" view on 2018 annual SBQ contract pricing.
    • TMST's losses are all the more glaring in light of gains across the rest of the steel sector following the U.S. government's move to slap steep import duties on steel from Vietnam that originated in China.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm reveals Snapdragon 845 detail

    • Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) releases details about its new Snapdragon 845 mobile phone chip, which will power high-end Android phones.
    • The Snapdragon 845 is built to increase security and battery life and optimized for AI tasks. 
    • The 845 marks the first time a Snapdragon chip has a separate Secure Processing Unit to store information including fingerprints and iris scans. 
    • A strong chip debut could help Qualcomm’s position amid an ongoing court battle with Apple, delayed NXP Semiconductors acquisition, and takeover offer from Broadcom that could become hostile.   
    • Qualcomm shares are up 0.69%.    
    • Previously: AMD confirms working with Qualcomm on Always Connected PCs (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 40 Comments
  • MRK

    Merck weak ahead of Roche data release from late-stage study of Tecentriq in lung cancer; shares down 3%

    • Merck (MRK -2.7%) slumps on over 50% higher volume ahead of an expected announcement tomorrow by Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY +1.4%) of results from a Phase 3 clinical trial, IMPOWER 150, assessing TECENTRIQ (atezolizumab), in combination with carboplatin and paclitaxel (C+P), with or without Avastin (bevacizumab), compared to C+P+Avastin in chemo-naive patients with metastatic non-squamous non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
    • The co-primary endpoints are progression-free survival (PGS) and overall survival (OS) up to ~32 months.
    • The data will be presented at the ESMO Immuno Oncology Congress in Geneva.
    • Merck is evaluating KEYTRUDA (pembrolizumab), in combination with pemetrexed/platinum chemo, in the same population of lung cancer patients in the Phase 3 Keynote-189 study with the same PFS and OS endpoints. The expected outcome has been under a bit of a cloud since the company withdrew its European marketing application in October.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Merck withdraws European marketing application for Keytruda in first-line NSCLC (Oct. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 5 Comments
  • MLNX

    Mellanox Tech +2.1% on bank talks rumor

    • Mellanox Technologies (NASDAQ:MLNX) shares are up 2.1% on rumors that the company is interviewing banks due to pressure from Starboard.
    • Source: Bloomberg, citing DealReporter.  
    • Previously: Starboard Value discloses 10.7% stake in Mellanox, wants to explore sale (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM

  • CREE

    Cree confirms exit of two execs

    • Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) confirms to the Triangle Business Journal reports that two top execs have left the company.
    • The departures were Daniel Castillo, president of the lighting division, and Keith Eagles, SVP of sales at the commercial lighting business. 
    • Both came to the company from Eaton last year and left shortly after Gregg Lowe took the CEO reins and promised a new strategic plan for the company. 
    • Cree shares are down 1.3%.
       
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 1 Comment

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: WLB +8%. ASM +6%. X +5%.

  • AGN

    Allergan's Saunders buys 4600 shares on open market

    • Allergan (AGN +1.6%) CEO Brent Saunders has purchased 4600 ordinary shares at ~$164.74 per share on the open market.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 15 Comments
  • GOOG

    Recode: Oracle waging war on Google

    • Recode reports that last month’s revelation that Google (GOOG, GOOGL) was tracking Android users without permission came from rival Oracle (NYSE:ORCL).  
    • Recode’s sources say Oracle has mounted a campaign against Google for the past year as the companies fight in federal court.
    • Other actions Oracle has taken against Google: $8.8M in lobbying, seeking EU penalties, and anti-Google billboards in Tennessee.
    • The legal fight goes back to 2010 when Oracle accused Google of copying Java to create Android. The next oral arguments in the current appeal begin tomorrow.
    • In other Google legal news, a California court dismissed class action claims that accused the company of sex-based discrimination.
    • Judge Mary Wiss said the lawsuit wasn’t appropriate because it included all female Google employees. The plaintiffs have 30 days to file a complaint on behalf of only the women who experienced pay discrimination. 
    • Oracle shares are up 0.9%.
    • Google shares are up 1.4%. 
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 8 Comments
  • IMMU

    Immunomedics' IMMU-132 shows 31% response rate in TNBC; shares ahead 19%

    • Immunomedics (IMMU +19%) is up triple normal although it has retraced 7% from its intraday high of $11.85.
    • The company just announced independently reviewed data from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing IMMU-132 (sacituzumab govitecan) in patients with metastatic triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC).
    • The overall response rate was 31% (n=34/110) including six complete responders and 28 partial responders. Median duration of response was 9.1 months. 34% (n=37/110) of the patients received at least three prior lines of therapy before IMMU-132.
    • The company will host an investor event today at 10:00 pm ET in San Antonio. Audio and slides will be webcast live via the Investor section on its website.
    • Previously: Immunomedics rallies 17% ahead of data release on lead candidate IMMU-132 (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • AYI

    Acuity Brands -3.8% after Pacific Square Research mention

    • Acuity Brands (NYSE:AYI) shares are down 3.4% after a cautious mention by Pacific Square Research.
    • The firm issued a Red Flag warning on concerns about rapid growth deceleration, intense competition in the LED market, and price declines. 
    • The firm also notes softness across industries, cash flow declines, and deteriorating margins. 
    • Acuity Brands shares are down 3.8%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • GBTC

    Successful test of Lightning Network announced

    • Causing some excitement in the cryptocurrency world in the past few minutes is the release of version 1.0 of the Lightning protocol specification, along with a successful cross-implementation test on Bitcoin mainnet.
    • In the first test, a coffee was purchased from Starblocks, and in the second an article from yalls.org - both in milliseconds.
    • Bitcoin remains sharply higher, up 9% to $12,734. Ether is lower by 3.9%, and Litecoin in flat.
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:UBIA, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, PRELF, OTCPK:BLKCF
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 42 Comments
  • VKTX

    Madrigal's mid-stage success with NASH candidate MGL-3196 stokes Viking Therapeutics, up 2%

    • Nano cap Viking Therapeutics (VKTX +2.2%) remains in positive territory on a 10x surge in volume despite retracing 20% from its intraday high of $3.51.
    • The action appears to be related to Madrigal Pharmaceuticals (MDGL +76.1%), up big after it announced positive Phase 2 results on NASH candidate MGL-3196, a selective agonist of a protein called thyroid hormone receptor-beta.
    • Viking's NASH candidate, VK2809, has the same mechanism of action. Topline results from a Phase 2 study should be available soon. According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated completion date is this month.
    • Previously: Madrigal Pharma's lead candidate successful in mid-stage NASH study; shares ahead 45% premarket (Dec. 6)
    • Previously: Viking Therapeutics' VK2809 shows positive effect in NASH model; shares ahead 9% premarket (Oct. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 5 Comments
  • VRA

    Investor show confidence in Vera Bradley turnaround

    • Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) is up 29% to trade at its highest level in a month.
    • Jefferies says investors are backing the retailer's shift away from a clearance model to focus on restoring the full price business.
    • The firm is also giving recently appointed Creative Officer Beatrice Mac Cabe credit for sparking a turnaround at Vera.
    • Previously: Vera Bradley higher after earnings (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: YIN +10%. FPAY +9%.
    • Losers: OPHC -13%. FRSX -9%. NAVG -7%. XIN -7%. LEJU -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • CGEAF

    Rogers considers sale of Blue Jays, Cogeco stake

    • Rogers Communications (RCI -0.1%) is examining asset sales, CFO Tony Staffieri says, which may reach to the Toronto Blue Jays baseball club and the company's stake in Cogeco (OTCPK:CGEAF).
    • Speaking at a UBS conference, Staffieri says the company doesn't need to own the Blue Jays to hold on to programming rights.
    • Selling assets will free up capital for other investments, he says.
    • Cogeco shares are down 1.8% in Toronto.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 4 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: MDGL +73%. CLNT +30%. AVAV +31%. VRA +29%. CLIR +23%. IMMU +21%. DPW +19%. ASTC +14%. WSCI +14%. VTVT +14%.
    • Losers: BIOC -34%. VHI -28%. CUR -28%. TROX -23%. OSIS -21%. FRED -20%. PXS -19%. CHKE -19%. BBG -18%. LQDT -17%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • MDGL

    NASH drug developers in the red after Madrigal's mid-stage success with MGL-3196

    • Investors are swarming over Madrigal Pharmaceuticals (MDGL +79.8%) after it reported positive results from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing MGL-3196 in NASH patients. Certain would-be NASH players have been brushed aside in early trading.
    • Selected tickers: (MNOV +0.9%)(GLMD)(RGLS -2.2%)(ICPT +0.4%)(CNAT -2.4%)(VBLT +1.6%)(GALT -8.7%)(SHPG -1.5%)(AGN +0.3%)(HZNP -1.2%)(OTCPK:GNFTF -5%)(VKTX +2.6%)
    • Previously: Madrigal Pharma's lead candidate successful in mid-stage NASH study; shares ahead 45% premarket (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 38 Comments
  • TEAR

    TearLab equity offering pressures shares, down 17%

    • Thinly traded nano cap TearLab (TEAR -17.2%) slumps on modestly higher volume in response to is direct offering of ~6.8M units at $0.44 per unit.
    • Each unit consists of one share of common stock, one Series A warrant and one Series B warrant.
    • Each five-year Series A warrant is exercisable at $0.44 per common share. Each six-month Series B warrant is also exercisable at $0.44 per common share.
    • Closing date is December 8.
    • Yesterday's close was $0.6303.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • INFY

    Infosys wants settlement on ex-CFO payout

    • Infosys (NASDAQ:INFY) wants to settle with India’s market regulator regarding a severance package for its former CFO Rajiv Bansal.
    • Infosys applied to the Securities and Exchange Board of India to resolve allegations surrounding the package, which included not seeking committee approval and failing to disclose the payout properly. 
    • Objections to Bansal’s payout led to infighting and the resignation of then CEO Vishal Sikka and chairman R. Seshasayee.       
    • Previously: Infosys taps another outsider as CEO (Dec. 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • IMMU

    Immunomedics rallies 17% ahead of data release on lead candidate IMMU-132

    • Immunomedics (IMMU +16.9%) jumps on modestly higher volume ahead its expected data release from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing lead candidate IMMU-132 (sacituzumab govitecan) in women with triple negative breast cancer.
    • The objective response rate of 34% was announced previously but investors are waiting for the results from an independent blinded review of the data. The announcement will be made at the San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium.
    • Previously: Wells defends Immunomedics, 19% selloff a "buying opportunity" (Nov. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 8 Comments
  • HIMX

    Himax -10.2% after Citron Research tweet

    • Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX) shares are down 9.9% after a Citron Research tweet.
    • Citron again accuses Himax of fraud and that it “looks like market starting to realize” the bogus story behind the company.  
    • Previously: Himax Technologies up after Q3 beats, mixed guidance (Nov. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 116 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: VRA +30%. OXM +9%. FBR +6%. WKHS +5%.
    • Losers: KOSS -6%. REED -6%. SQBG -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple suppliers drop after Largan warns of lower Dec. revenue

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) supplier Largan Precision (OTC:LGANF) warns of lower December revenue compared to the previous month.
    • Largan had $187.2M in November sales, which was flat on October but up 8% on the year. 
    • The revenue drop comes in a period that’s traditionally strong for iPhone shipments. Largan supplies lenses and Face ID modules for the devices.
    • Taiwan’s Economic Daily News reports that Largan’s weak December comes from a drop in orders but didn’t specify from which customers. 
    • Yuanta Investment Consulting analyst Jeff Pu thinks Apple has cut back iPhone X orders from 69M to 63M for the November to March period after previously cutting iPhone 8 and 8 Plus for 1Q18 to 16M units, half of the current quarter.   
    • Apple suppliers moving on the news: Skyworks Solutions (SWKS -0.8%), Cirrus Logic (CRUS -1.6%), Broadcom (AVGO -1.2%), and Qorvo (QRVO -3.8%).       
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 39 Comments
  • X

    U.S. Steel, AK Steel surge on tariff ruling; Axiom's Johnson pooh-poohs news

    • Steel names including U.S. Steel (X +6.4%) and AK Steel (AKS +5.5%) enjoy hefty gains following the Commerce Department's move to impose import duties on steel from Vietnam that originated in China.
    • While the market is rewarding the shares today, Axiom Capital's Gordon Johnson maintains the DoC's decision is "virtually irrelevant in terms of supply/demand."
    • Johnson says imports of cold rolled coil and hot-dip galvanizing steel have "virtually collapsed" since November of last year.
    • Vietnam suppliers say their product does not include Chinese components, and U.S. importers have continued to buy their steel, meaning that Johnson expects about half of the current imported Vietnamese steel gets banned incrementally.
    • Also: NUE +1.2%, STLD +1.3%, CMC +2.4%, MT +1.9%, CLF +1.3%, WOR +0.4%, RS +0.8%, SLX +0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 32 Comments
  • JW.A

    Wiley at 2.5-year highs after earnings beat

    • John Wiley & Sons (NYSE:JW.A) is up 2% and setting new 2.5-year highs today after fiscal Q2 earnings report where it beat expectations on top and bottom lines.
    • EPS rose 32% (22% in constant currency), as lower interest expense combined with higher operating income.
    • Revenue rose 6% and was up 3% in constant currency, mainly driven by growth in research journals, STM and Professional Publishing, and Education Services/Online Program Management.
    • Revenue by segment: Research, $228.9M (up 11%); Publishing, $165M (up 1%); Solutions, $57.9M (up 3%).
    • It's reaffirmed fiscal 2018 guidance for revenue about even with 2017's $1.719B and adjusted EPS declining in the low single digits from 2017's $3.01. It also sees cash from operations rising to $350M or more, and capex slightly lower than this year's $148.3M.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • SQNS

    Sequans files for mixed shelf

    • Sequans Communications (NYSE:SQNS) files for a mixed shelf of up to $100M.
    • Certain selling security holders can offer nd sell up to 10M American Depository Shares. 
    • Sequans shares are down 2.76%.        
    • Previously: Sequans Communications reports Q3 results and in-line guidance (Oct. 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 14 Comments
  • EIX

    Edison down another 1.5% as California wildfires spread

    • Shares of Edison International (EIX -1.5%) keep falling as the southern California fires keep spreading, as tens of thousands residents in the northern Los Angeles foothills are forced to evacuate amid power outages throughout the area.
    • Five wildfires are raging in the Los Angeles area, near Bel-Air, Ventura, Sylmar, Santa Clarita and San Bernadino.
    • A fire burning near the Getty Center closed large portions of the 405 freeway just as rush hour got under way this morning; the Los Angeles Fire Department says more than 200 firefighters are fighting the blaze near the 405.
    • Shares are downgraded to Neutral from Buy at Mizuho, while Deutsche Bank cuts its stock price target for EIX to $78 and SunTrust trims its target price to $85.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • BIOC

    Biocept's equity offering pressures shares, down 36%

    • Biocept (BIOC -35.7%) slumps on a 7x surge in volume in response to its public offering of ~4.9M shares of common stock at $0.68 per share. Net proceeds should be ~$3M. Closing date is tomorrow, December 7.
    • Yesterday's close was $1.15.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 9 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: MDGL +78%. CLRB +13%. VSAR-OLD +11%. DVA +10%. VKTX +10%.
    • Losers: BIOC -35%. CUR -24%. CASI -15%. ZYNE -10%. MBRX -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 6 Comments
  • LEE

    Lee Enterprises -3.1% as print ad revenues continue decline

    • Lee Enterprises (NYSE:LEE) is off 3.1% after Q4 earnings showed profits that improved but missed expectations on declining revenues.
    • EBITDA was down 1.1% to $36.7M (the best Y/Y change in EBITDA in two years).
    • Earnings were $3.5M, up from a year-ago $0.7M.
    • Digital ad revenue rose 6.1%, helped make up in part for a soft print ad environment. Subscription revenues were up 0.6% for the quarter.
    • Average daily newspaper circulation came to 0.8M; Sunday circulation was 1.1M.
    • Debt as of Sept. 24 is $548.4M after being reduced by $20.1M in the quarter and $68.8M in the fiscal year. Liquidity was $44.4M.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • SNP

    Reuters: Sinopec seeking to sell its Nigeria oil business

    • Sinopec (SNP -1.8%) has hired BNP Paribas to sell its oil business in Nigeria and Gabon, part of the Chinese company scaling back its presence in Africa, Reuters reports.
    • SNP spent $7.24B in 2009 for Switzerland-based Addax Petroleum, its largest ever foreign oil acquisition, to obtain land in Nigeria, Gabon, Cameroon and Iraq that was licensed for extraction and exploration, but it is now planning to sell Addax’s onshore and offshore oil and gas production sites in Nigeria and Gabon, the report says; SNP’s Cameroon operation would be its only remaining project in Africa.
    • The hunt for overseas assets was intended to bulk up energy reserves and meet future demand from China, but lower oil prices have made some of the investments unprofitable; also, China's economy has slowed a bit, and recent terror attacks on oil and gas facilities in Nigeria have further discouraged SNP.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • OSIS

    OSI Systems -11.8% after Muddy Waters report

  • JUNO

    Juno inks three agreements to advance program in multiple myeloma; shares ahead 4% premarket

    • Juno Therapeutics (NASDAQ:JUNO) is up 4% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement that it has consummated three contracts to support the advancement of its program in multiple myeloma (MM) using gamma secretase inhibitors (GSIs) in combination with BCMA-directed CAR T cells.
    • One of the agreements is with Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) for the rights to its GSI candidate LY3039478. Agreements with OncoTracker and Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center secured the rights to intellectual property related to combinations of GSIs and BCMA-directed engineered T cells.
    • Gamma secretase is an enzyme that cleaves a group of transmembrane proteins, including BCMA. Studies have shown that treatment with GSIs can increase the surface expression of BCMA on cancer cells, especially MM, which may boost the efficacy of BCMA-directed CAR T therapy.
    • Financial terms are not disclosed.

  • MDGL

    Madrigal Pharma's lead candidate successful in mid-stage NASH study; shares ahead 45% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap Madrigal Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MDGL) is up 45% premarket on light volume on the heels of its announcement of positive results from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing lead candidate MGL-3196 in patients with biopsy-confirmed nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).
    • The study met its primary endpoint of a statistically significant reduction in liver fat from baseline as measured by an non-invasive imaging test called MRI-PDFF. Specifically, the change from baseline in MRI-PDFF in the overall treatment group was -36.3% versus -9.6% for placebo (p<0.0001).
    • The percentage of patients achieving at least a 30% reduction in liver fat was 60.3% compared to 18.4% for placebo (p<0.0001). A 30% or more reduction in liver fat is associated with an improvement in NASH as determined by biopsy.
    • Significant improvements in liver enzymes and lipids were also observed.
    • MGL-3196's safety profile was favorable with most adverse events (AEs) considered mild. Three serious AEs were reported, none related to the study drug.
    • The trial is ongoing. Additional data will be assessed at week 36. The estimated study completion date is March 2018.
    • MGL-3196 is a once-daily, orally available, liver-directed selective thyroid hormone receptor-beta agonist.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM | 1 Comment

  • ARWR

    Arrowhead Pharma's HBV candidate ACR-520 shows positive effect in mid-stage study; shares up 11% premarket

    • New data from a Phase 2 clinical trial, Heparc-2001, assessing Arrowhead Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:ARWR) lead candidate ARC-520 in patients with chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection showed a significant reduction in HBV surface antigen (HBsAg) seven months after the last dose. Specifically, HBsAg levels were reduced by a maximum of 100,000 copies/mL (5.0 log10) from baseline, just above the lower limit of quantitation.
    • The results were presented at the HEP DART meeting in Kona, HI. Development is ongoing.
    • ARC-520 is an RNAi therapeutic that intervenes upstream of the reverse transcription process where current standard-of-care nucleotide and nucleoside analogs act and is designed to silence the production of all HBV gene products.
    • Shares are up 11% premarket on light volume.
    • Previously: FDA places clinical hold on Arrowhead's mid-stage study of lead product candidate in hepatitis B e antigen-positive patients (Nov. 8, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM | 3 Comments
